definition: lit. without wind there cannot be waves (idiom); there must be a reason/no smoke without fire
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
(negative prefix)/not/no

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
wave/breaker/unrestrained/dissipated/to stroll/to ramble

sentences.english: She must have done that sort of thing. Where there’s smoke there’s fire.
sentences.chinese: 无风不起浪，我想她肯定做过那种事。

sentences.english: But the voters might not. They would say where there's smoke there's fire.
sentences.chinese: 但选民不一定懂得，他们会说无风不起浪。

sentences.english: Where there is smoke, there is fire.
sentences.chinese: 有烟就有火，无风不起浪。

definition: lit. wind from an empty cave (idiom)/fig. unfounded (story)/baseless (claim)
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
(confirm to be) true/authentic
reliable evidence (idiom); conclusive proof/definitive evidence
rumor
three men talking makes a tiger (idiom); repeated rumor becomes a fact
lit. flies do not attack an intact egg (idiom)/fig. no smoke without a fire
pinyin: cang1 ying5 bu4 ding1 wu2 feng4 dan4

definition: lit. public opinion is powerful enough to melt metal (idiom)/fig. public clamor can obscure the actual truth/mass spreading of rumors can confuse right and wrong
lit. one palm alone cannot clap (proverb)/fig. it takes two persons to start a dispute/it takes two to tango/it's difficult to achieve anything without support
pinyin: yi1 ge5 ba1 zhang3 pai1 bu4 xiang3

definition: to spread falsehoods/to increasingly distort the truth/to pile errors on top of errors (idiom)
lit. to believe in the rain on hearing the wind (idiom)/to believe rumors/to be credulous
hearsay/gossip
fabrication relying on nothing (idiom); frame-up
rumor/gossip/to spread rumors
gossip/hearsay/rumor
If you want to condemn sb, don't worry about the pretext (idiom, from Zuozhuan 左傳|左传); one can always trump up a charge against sb/Give a dog a bad name, then hang him.
pinyin: yu4 jia1 zhi1 zui4 , he2 huan4 wu2 ci2
